body_html: The thing is I have a training graph that holds a bunch of variables that are relevant for training, but not for the model (e.g. global_step). I have 2 savers, one that stores all my variables, to checkpoint the training process, so I can resume training if necessary. And one trainer to save my model at the end of training. This is why I want to explicitly manipulate a saver.

body: The thing is I have a training graph that holds a bunch of variables that are relevant for training, but not for the model (e.g. global_step). I have 2 savers, one that stores all my variables, to checkpoint the training process, so I can resume training if necessary. And one trainer to save my model at the end of training. This is why I want to explicitly manipulate a saver.
